channel.title: PSA: Stop joining IRC then immediately leaving because "nobody talks"
channel.description:
Honestly, this type of thing happens all the time. Someone will join the IRC channels, stay for a few seconds, and leave because they think nobody is talking.
Look, I took a screenshot this time: [img]http://i.imgur.com/euiYgND.png[/img]
Look at the timestamps, he was in #mopar for less than 20 seconds, and in #moparscape (not pictured) for 2 minutes 23 seconds. I can't even make a cup of tea in 2 minutes 23 seconds. Not to bloody mention it's 4:10pm (UTC) on a Tuesday, Europeans are still in school or are working, Americans are just leaving for school or work, and it's well past midnight for Australians and New Zealanders.
If you want to join IRC and have a conversation, great. Here's how you do it:
[ol][li]Get a proper desktop client, [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,446520.0.html]tutorial here[/url][/li] [li]Grow some thick skin[/li] [li]Idle.[/li] [li]Idle.[/li] [li]Idle.[/li] [li]Idle.[/li] [li]Idle.[/li] [li]Idle.[/li] [li]Idle.[/li] [li]No, but seriously, sit around for a while. Do something else while you're here. Play a game. Make a cup of tea. The world is your oyster.[/li] [li]Introduce yourself[/li] [li]???[/li] [li]Profit[/li][/ol]
People make out like IRC is some scary place where newcomers are literally sacrificed to Satan but it simply isn't true. If you want to use IRC there's only a few things you need to keep in mind, #mopar is [b]not[/b] for moparscape, #moparscape is. You know what #mopar is for? It's that website you've probably never heard of, moparisthebest.com. If you want moparscape related talk, or private server related talk, you must be in #moparscape.
The second thing you need to keep in mind is that people generally don't join IRC to chat then leave immediately, instead people join IRC through a desktop client and leave that client open all the time and only periodically open their client to talk. The last thing to keep in mind is that while yes, IRC can be a bit unwelcoming, you have to understand that a lot of the people who use IRC have been doing so for years and a lot of us have had a lot of experience with new people coming in acting entitled like IRC is there for them. Don't be that person who joins IRC, asks a question, then flames the channel for not getting an answer.
I hope I cleared the IRC situation up a little. Come join us, we're not that bad of a bunch.
EDIT: Mr. Sppt has informed me that I forgot the credits. Therefore, credits: 90% me ;D 10% Sppt (for pro credit reminder), 5% Greeny (for being green), and 1% Satan. I mean God.

@classic wrote:

there is something called the moparscape effect where people who are about 5 months into irc start to think they are in this uh SECRET irc society and there is something special about these people compared to all the other people

they start to say stuff like “moparscapers” and “mitb is gr8 compared to moparscape i hate that place”

calm down this entire community is collectively autistic there isn’t any difference, just join and be yourself
